Interface EfsScheduledExecutor.IEfsTimer

All Superinterfaces:
AutoCloseable, Comparable<EfsScheduledExecutor.IEfsTimer>
Enclosing class:
EfsScheduledExecutor
public static interface EfsScheduledExecutor.IEfsTimer extends AutoCloseable, Comparable<EfsScheduledExecutor.IEfsTimer>
A scheduled timer task which may be active, expired, or canceled. Once a timer is expired or canceled, it will never expire again.
Author:
Charles W. Rapp

  • Method Details

    • timerName

      @Nullable String timerName()
      Returns user-defined timer name. May be null or an empty string.
      Returns:
      user-defined timer name.

    • timerState

      EfsScheduledExecutor.TimerState timerState()
      Returns timer current state.
      Returns:
      timer current state.
      See Also:
      • isCanceled()
      • isDone()

    • timerType

      EfsScheduledExecutor.TimerType timerType()
      Returns timer type.
      Returns:
      timer type.

    • delay

      Duration delay()
      Returns remaining delay until this timer expires. If timer is either expired (and not a repeating timer) or if timer is cancelled, then returns Duration.ZERO.
      Returns:
      remaining delay until timer expires.

    • isCanceled

      boolean isCanceled()
      Returns true if this task was successfully canceled prior to expiration. Note that this task may be inactive due to expiration.
      Returns:
      true if task is canceled.
      See Also:
      • timerState()
      • isDone()

    • cancelReason

      EfsScheduledExecutor.CancelReason cancelReason()
      Returns reason why timer is no longer running.
      Returns:
      timer cancellation reason.

    • cancelException

      @Nullable Exception cancelException()
      Returns exception associated with cancelReason() returning EfsScheduledExecutor.CancelReason.TASK_EXCEPTION. Returns null for any other cancel reason.
      Returns:
      task exception.

    • isRepeating

      boolean isRepeating()
      Return true if timer is repeating.
      Returns:
      true if timer is repeating.

    • isDone

      boolean isDone()
      Returns true if this task is no longer active. This could be due to either expiration or cancellation, there is no distinction between the two.
      Returns:
      true if task is no longer active.
      See Also:
      • timerState()
      • isCanceled()
